column4: Oh.. sorry.. Well I just got Ubuntu and I downloaded a .deb and went to open it and got this message.  /tmp/cairo-dock_v2.0.8_i686-1.deb could not be opened, because the associated helper application does not exist. Change the association in your preferences.
dpkg -i filename.deb
you can create the folder with 'mkdir .cairo'
create the folder in your home directory (shorthand for your home directory is just the tilde ~) and put your theme into there
will try
also, welcome to Ubuntu.  :)  Feel free to experiment with your operating system.  We'll gladly answer any questions you've got.
Thanks.. SO far its tricky but I Love the look and feel
mkdir .cairo like that? With the space?
mkdir is short for Make Directory.
I cannot find the theme in the application it self. It only shows the default one.. I made mkdir .cairo in the home folder and added the folder of the theme into it and had no luck..
I cannot help you with the theme itself.  I just knew how to help you get the directory created that the application was looking for.
there you go.  Create the directory .cairo-dock and put the theme in THERE.  Not going to tell you how to do it, just use what I told you last time.
type this:  mkdir .cairo-dock && mkdir .cairo-dock/themes
that will create both directories.  Put the theme into the themes directory
where did you get the plugin from?
I was on YouTube.. It said to download it.. Then do the manual install. I installed from Adobe's website
OK.. How do I go about removing the current one.. so firefox won't close on me
erm..  I honestly don't k now.
By the way.. I go this from the terminal running the sudo command thing ...  " sudo apt-get install flashplayer-nonfree "
It says within the message flashplugin-nonfree is already the newest version.
I'll give you credit.  You're certainly brute forcing your way through the issues you're having.  :)  Hats off to you.
Thanks     zortec: Checking now
